title: DSCP option isn't actually marking packets
body:
The DSCP marks functionality added in v1.55.0 doesn't seem to be working at all. @xenago and I tested on the following platform/version/backend combinations, and rclone didn't produce DSCP-marked packets on any of them:
* macOS 10.14 (Mojave), rclone 1.55.1, Google Drive IPv4 & IPv6
* Windows 10 20H2, rclone 1.55.1, Google Drive IPv4, Onedrive (personal) IPv4
* OpenSUSE Tumbleweed, rclone 1.55.0, Google Drive IPv4 & IPv6

I originally discovered the problem while using the restic integration, but the behaviour is the same on a simple copy too. I also used iperf3 to verify that DSCP tags weren't being mangled/washed by the network stack, and iperf3 emitted DSCP-tagged packets as expected.

**How to reproduce:**

1. Start tcpdump/Wireshark/tshark
2. Invoke rclone with the `--dscp LE` argument (works for all possible values, not just `LE`). For example: `rclone --dscp LE copy testfile remote:`. Optionally, add `--bind <address>` to force IPv4 on a dual-stack host.
3. After rclone finishes, check the DiffServ field of an outgoing packet to see that it isn't being marked (CS0). In Wireshark, this shows as `Differentiated Services Field: 0x00 (DSCP: CS0, ECN: Not-ECT)` for IPv4, and `Traffic Class: 0x00 (DSCP: CS0, ECN: Not-ECT)` for IPv6.

I've attached the following:
* A packet capture from the macOS example (IPv6) [rclone-dscp-bug-mac-v6.pcapng.gz](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/6402470/rclone-dscp-bug-mac-v6.pcapng.gz)
* The corresponding debug log [rclone-dscp-bug-mac.log](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/6402471/rclone-dscp-bug-mac.log)

Neither of us is familiar with golang, but I'll try to get a debug build running to narrow down the problem. I wanted to put it out there in case somebody more familiar with rclone/golang can spot the error faster.

**Edit:**

I put it into a debugger, and the problem appears to be in `dialer.go`: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/9e2fbe0f1a9314e1330b4adc9d69de137be12ee6/fs/fshttp/dialer.go#L48-L68

I set breakpoints at lines 55-57. 55 and 56 are called as expected, but **line 57 is never reached**. Therefore, `SetTrafficClass`/`SetTOS` are never called.

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
